Developers Studyjam Android Fundamental
events.description:
Ticket URL

Ticket : http://www.meraevents.com/event/developers-studyjam-android-fundamental

Google Developers Study Jams is an 8-week series of in-person, community-run study groups to support students taking online Udacity courses on Google developer technologies. These events are run by local Google Developer Groups or other developer meetups all over the world. This season, we are running Study Jams around the Udacity 

Dâ€‹eveloping Android Apps: Android Fundamentalsâ€‹

 course.

Study Jams are an opportunity for students to receive  in-person guidance and tutoring on the Udacity course in a fun classroom environment. Study Jam sessions are designed around the Udacity course structure, with a weekly session following each lesson (6 lessons), plus two additional weeks for completing and sharing course final projects. Students are expected to come to the Study Jam sessions having completed that week’s Udacity lesson online, so that the Study Jam time may be used to review key concepts, address questions, and work on individual projects. The live community atmosphere and tutoring is designed to help students achieve deeper learning around the concepts taught in the course.

All are welcome to join a Study Jam, though students should first be sure to meet the course prerequisites and requirements: â€‹

Developing Android Apps: Android Fundamentals

 is intended for students with at least 3 years of programming experience in Java or another object­-oriented programming language. You will be expected to download

Android Studio

 in order to follow along with the instructors throughout the course. You should also be comfortable working with code on 

Github

. Access to an Android device is helpful, but not required, to complete the final project. Please see 

Technology Requirements

 for using Udacity.

Students who attend all Study Jam sessions and complete a final project will receive a Study Jams badge of completion. This badge is different from the official Udacity Android Fundamentals course certification. Please see “How can I obtain certification for the course?” below for more information.

events.name: International Women's Day 2016
events.description:
INTERNATIONAL WOMEN'S DAY 2016

Our Time To Lead

Registration : http://gdgbbsr.com/iwd16/

Google strives to cultivate a wholly inclusive workplace around the globe. A key component of that vision is empowering women to pursue their dreams and build tools that change the world.

Having a diversity of perspectives and ideas leads to better decision-making, more relevant products, and makes the industry much more interesting. We believe that by creating the right environments, programs and policies, women in tech are better positioned to drive transformational change in the industry and beyond.

Benefits Attending IWD eventLearn from lead women in technology and entrepreneurs, Get inspired by other women in technology, Participate in fun contests and win prizes, Participation certificates, Free swags/goodies for every woman participants, Free food and beverages

events.name: Cloud Next Extended 2017
events.description:
The future of cloud is now, at Next.

Get new ideas. Learn from industry experts. Engage with peers. Join us for an immersive event that brings together executives, customers, partners, developers, IT decision makers, and Google Engineers to build the future of the cloud. Choose from over 200 sessions on Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps, Devices, and more.

events.name: Google IO Extended 2017 Bhubaneswar
events.description:
I/O Extended events include a variety of options for developers—from live streaming sessions to local demos, hackathons, codelabs, and more. These events are hosted in your neighborhood by local developer communities.

Hang out with local developers and experience I/O together. Search for events near you and get involved in the action.

events.name: Using Machine Learning for a Better World
events.description:
From marketing, medicine to web security and the smart self driving cars, Machine Learning has left no field untouched.  Machine learning is making the world we live in smarter, helping us find answers to complex problems ranging from climate change to education.

It's already evident that we can make a better world with Machine learning.It is so omnipresent that it won’t be long before “skilled in machine learning” becomes the new “proficient in Excel” as a standard bullet point on your resume!

This will be an exciting time for ML Developers and Enthusiasts to deal with data to build solutions for a better world, so join us!

Register here: tiny.cc/mlmeetup

Please note we have limited seats for the event.

events.name: GDG DevFest 2017 Season Hackathon Preliminary - KIIT University

venue.name: School of Computer Engineering, KIIT University
venue.address_1: Campus-15, KIIT University, Chandaka Industrial Estate, Patia

events.description:
GDG Bhubaneswar is a community of all local developers of Bhubaneswar. We, Google Developer Group Bhubaneswar, are organizing a mega developers' meetup DevFest 2017 Season in September. We are also organizing a Hackathon as a part of DevFest. We have a qualification round for this hackathon and it will be a coding test which may take around a couple of hours. We are organizing this qualification rounds at different colleges of Bhubaneswar on 20th August 2017.

Finalists for the hackathon will be selected from these preliminary rounds and they will compete for glory. Finalists will be given an opportunity to demo their apps in front of all attendees of DevFest 2017 Bhubaneswar. There are good prizes for the winners and goodies for all finalists. We will announce the prizes soon.

This meetup event is only for the students of KIIT and students of other institutes near KIIT. The number of seats is limited and more preference will be given to KIIT students. RSVP "Yes" only if you are a student of KIIT or an Institute near KIIT and 100% sure of attending the event. If you RSVP "Yes" and don't attend, you won't be allowed to attend our future events.

All participants need to bring their laptop fully charged for the event and they need to use it for around 2 hours during the test. No power facility to charge laptops will be provided. Also, try to bring your own WiFi hotspot if you are a non-KIIT student or have problem to connect to the campus WiFi.

events.name: GDG DevFest 2017 Season - Bhubaneswar
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Agenda:
9:00 AM Registration & Welcome Coffee
10:00 AM to 12:30 PM  Product Introductions, Talks, and Presentations by top teams of the Hackathon
10:00 AM to 10:15 AM Introduction to GDG Bhubaneswar and Women Techmakers
10:15 AM to 11:00 AM Machine Learning & TensorFlow by Manoranjan Padhy from Google
11:00 AM to 11:15 AM Presentation by Hackathon participants
11:15 AM to 11:45 AM UI/UX for Dummies by Basant Moharana, Themeco, USA
11:45 AM to 12:00 PM Presentation by Hackathon participants
12:00 PM to 12:30 PM Integrating Firebase in iOS Apps by Surya Narayan Barik, Processmap
12:30 PM Lunch time
2:00 PM to 4:30 PM  Product Introductions, Talks, and Presentations by top teams of the Hackathon continues
2:00 PM to 2:30 PM Presentation of interesting projects in Machine Learning and AI 
2:30 PM to 2:45 PM Presentation by Hackathon participants
2:45 PM to 3:15 PM ABC of Graph QL by Sanmaya Kumar Dhal, CEO, SlickAccount
3:15 PM to 3:30 PM Presentation by Hackathon participants
3:30 PM to 4:00 PM Introduction to Blockchain and Bitcoin Development by Sanjib Parida, Orbonix Labs
4:00 PM to 4:15 PM Presentation by Hackathon participants
4:15 PM to 4:30 PM Prize distribution
4:30 PM Coffee Break / Networking
5:00 PM Closing & Happy Hour

*Agenda subject to change

events.name: Women TechMakers Oct Meetup: Diving into Machine Learning
events.description:
We are thrilled to announce that Women TechMakers Bhubaneswar is hosting its October meetup on October 29th, Sunday- 09:00 AM at IIIT Bhubaneswar Campus. 

Interested in Machine Learning? This event is an introductory workshop geared towards those with basic programming experience in Python. Join us in getting started with machine learning using TensorFlow. Please note that the meetup is only for women and spots are limited. Register soon.

events.description: 2 days interactive workshop on android app design and development by GDG Bhubaneswar.

events.description:
Engage users through the Google Assistant

Build apps for the Google Assistant even if you don't know how to code. Your apps can engage users through 100M+ devices including voice-activated speakers, Android phones, iPhones, Android TVs, and more.

Developer Programs Engineer for Actions on Google out in Mountain View.

events.name: Google Developer Days India 2017 - Extended Bhubaneswar
events.description:
• What we'll do
Google Developer Days (GDD) are global events showcasing the latest developer products and platforms from Google to help you quickly develop high quality apps, grow & retain an active user base, and tap into tools to earn more.

GDD India 2017 Extended -Bhubaneswar is all-day developer event that offers a variety of options for attendees—from streaming sessions to local demos, codelabs, and more.

Please reserve your slot HERE ON MEETUP. We shall also send you a form to fill so that we can understand our audience.
• Who should attend?
This event is for developers and tech enthusiasts who are interested in using Google technologies.
• Important to know
GDD are global events showcasing the latest developer products and platforms from Google to help you quickly develop high quality apps, grow & retain an active user base, and tap into tools to earn more.
#GDDIndia

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam - Bhubaneswar
events.description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Agenda:
10:15am: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
11:45am: Break
12:15pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
1:45pm: Event ends

• What to bring
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

• Important to know
Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

events.name: Android Things At MakerFest Odisha
events.description:
• What we'll do
Android Things
Build connected devices for a wide variety of consumer, retail, and industrial applications . More at https://developer.android.com/things/index.html

Maker Fest is the Indian continuation of Maker Faire hosted across America, Europe, Africa and Japan, among others. Maker Fest, which launched in Ahmedabad, India in 2014, now hosts thousands attendees a year. It is the amalgamation of festivals celebrating the innovators and an art show with all the booths for inventors and demonstrations and workshops for attendees. Creators, artists and hobbyist across the country are invited to present their contemporary applications of ideas using the vast ocean of art, science and technology. Also, it is noncommercial and free for the public to attend. More at http://makerfestodisha.com/

• What to bring

• Important to know

events.name: Women Techmakers IWD Bhubaneswar Event
events.description:
• What we'll do
Hola, Let us meet up on 18th March, for a day-long event talking about technology. Let's collaborate and build inclusive-tech. We are eager to hear stories from all the amazing women making great things happen. We are also looking forward to listening to the inspiring men around us who support the idea of inclusivity and believe diversity is important. Let's celebrate women's day together and inspire each other to make technology accessible for everyone to delve and explore.

This year's theme: Building a New Horizon

Agenda:
10:00am - Welcome Note and Introductions
10:15 am - Speaker Session (Annapurna Agrawal)
10:45 am - DIY Leadership Activity
11:00 am - Speaker Session (Jayant Rajwani)
11:30 am - DIY Leadership Activity
11:40 am - Speaker Session (Student Speakers)
12:00 pm -Speaker Session (Sriyank Siddhartha)
12:30 pm - Break
12:40 pm - Speaker Session (Neha Ambasta)
1:15 pm -Networking Lunch and Ideathon

• What to bring
Only Curiosity and empathy for collaborative learning!

events.name: Build Actions on Google that Solve for India
events.description:
Build Actions for Your Community

*If you are on the waitlist and have not filled in the application form, then please check your emails (Social tab/category on Gmail) and look for emails from Meetup.com. There you will find a link to a Google Form. Please fill in that ASAP. We will send invites to selected members who fill in the form. Only invited members can attend this event.

A Hackathon event. The event is about building a Google Assistant app yourself.

Venue: Silicon Institute of Technology
Event dates:
Day 1: 29th July 2018
Day 2: 4th August 2018

To have an effective participation you must know a programming knowledge preferably Javascript ( It is okay if you do not know JS, you can still participate if you know any other programming language ). Since it is you who will build Google Assistant App, so prior to the event you need to do some homework about what is Google Assistant and how to build Actions on Google. Trust me, it is super easy.

Join us to build innovative and unique actions that are locally relevant, taking into account aspects of language, devices, battery consumption and connectivity, solving problems for India in the space of agriculture, education, healthcare, fintech, e-commerce etc.

#IndiaBuildsActions

Categories to choose from to Build your Actions
We have narrowed down on a few themes that you could pick to solve for India by building actions.

Agriculture
Education
Healthcare
E-commerce
Fintech
Entertainment
Open category

#GoogleAssistant

events.name: Build Actions on Google that Solve for India (Day 2)
events.description:
Build Actions for Your Community

* This event is for members who attended Build Actions on Google that Solve for India (Day 1) on 29th July 2018.

In this event, all participants will present their Actions on Google.

If you could not attend Build Actions on Google that Solve for India (Day 1) on 29th July 2018 but still building an Actions on Google, then please contact us to get an entry to the event.

#GoogleAssistant

events.name: Google Cloud Next '18 Extended Bhubaneswar
events.description:
** This is an invite-only event. Apply for an invitation here: http://bit.ly/next18bbsr

** Walk-ins are allowed for professional developers.

Join us for this year's Next Extended event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '18 experience.

This year, we will be diving deep into cloud with technical keynotes, a hands-on TOPIC (Kubernetes, ML, or Google Cloud Certification) lab, and local speakers.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook), and get ready for the best Next Extended yet!

Make sure to subscribe to all our messages to receive upcoming information about this event, and visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/ to learn more about Google Cloud Next '18.

** This is an invite-only event. Apply for an invitation here: http://bit.ly/next18bbsr

events.name: Web Development Study Jam
events.description:
VENUE : CET, Hall B-407

NOTE: The registrations are closed. Be sure to check this event page here at the meetup for further updates.

This study jam on web development will be focused on the very basic concepts of HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Javascript, and jQuery. Participants will learn the details of these technologies and get hands-on experience.

The target audience for this Study Jam:
1) Those who want to get started with web development.
2) Anyone who has a little or no experience in programming.

Why be a part of this Study Jam?
-> Work with Google instructors step-by-step to build a fully responsive, cross-browser compatible and functional web page for registration.
-> Run your first webpage in the browser
-> Learn how to implement validations to the registration form
-> Learn about fundamentals: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap classes, Javascript and various jQuery Plugins

Complete the course and get Google-offered Study Jam completion goodies and a kick start to getting started with web development.

Date and Time:
Saturday, September 1, 2018, 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM
and Sunday, September 2, 2018, 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM
Participants need to attend both the days.

Venue: CET, Bhubaneswar
HALL B-407

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Bhubaneswar
events.description:
Event Details:
Dates: September 22nd, 29th, ​and October 6th,​​ 2018 [3-day​ event ]

Timing: 2pm to 6pm

Venue: Silicon Institute of Technology, Patia, Bhubaneshwar

Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

The target audience for Flutter Study Jam:
1) Those just getting started with mobile app development
2) Those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

Why be a part of this Study Jam?
-> Work with Google instructors step-by-step to build a fully functional native “Unit Converter App” for both iOS and Android using Flutter
-> Learn how to set up your environment and start building your first Flutter application
-> Learn about fundamentals: UI Widgets, App State, Material Design, User Interaction and Gestures, and Packages
-> Learn how to structure and architect your app and use Flutter's tooling to build apps efficiently

Complete the course and get Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

events.name: DevFest 2018
events.description:
NOTE: At present when you RSVP, you'll be moved to the waitlist. Once the registration process is over we'll confirm your seat based on some criteria.

What is DevFest?
Watch the video here: https://bit.ly/devfest-gdg

DevFests are community-led, developer events hosted by GDG chapters around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies. Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community and region that hosts it.

Venue: Hotel Hindustan International (HHI), Shriya Talkies Street, Kharvel Nagar, Bhubaneswar, India
Date: 28th October 2018
Time: 9:00 am to 5:00 am

Event Agenda and Details
--> https://www.gdgbbsr.com/gdg-devfest-2018/

To participate, here is the simple registration process :
--> RSVP and join the waitlist here. Don't forget to answer the simple question after you join the waitlist.
--> Complete your profile (incomplete profile won't be confirmed for the event). Ignore, if already done.
- https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/profile/

The registration will close on 23rd October, 10 pm.

Seats are limited. See you in DevFest.

Featured sessions:
"Server-side development with Kotlin" by Wisdom D’Almeida,

"Do more with less code using Flutter" by Pooja Bhaumik,

"Faster Android App Development using Kotlin and Jetpack" by Sriyank Siddhartha

and many other sessions in #AndroidDev, #TensorFlow, #MachineLearning, #GoogleCloud by Annapurna Agrawal, Sanjib Parida and others. Visit interesting sandboxes, chill, and network at Community Lounge, participate in networking and fun events.

Important: GDG Bhubaneswar has a very strict no-show policy for all events which might affect your seat confirmation in our future events. If your seat is confirmed, you have to attend the event.

events.name: GDG HackFEST < CodeAndWin />
events.description:
READ ALL INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY

How to attend this event?
1. Fill this form in the first place: https://goo.gl/forms/uDzEhqMfyNZJkaOy1
2. Join waitlist here: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/events/256933697/
Your RSVP won't be confirmed if you skip any of the step mentioned above.

What's the agenda?
Your team will be given a problem statement to solve. Your team needs to finish the task. The best team wins.
You will be notified the problem statement 2 days before the event starts. You can immediately start working on it once you get notified.

Which technology to use?
There will be multiple problem statements. You can choose any 'one' of them and solve it using either Android, IOT or Machine Learning ( preferably TensorFlow ).

Am I eligible for the event?
If you have any experience in 'one' of the following technologies then you are fit for the event.
1. Android
2. IOT
3. Machine Learning ( preferably Tensorflow )

Is it a team work? How can I form a team?
Yes it is. While filling up the form ( link to form is mentioned above ), you need to mention your team members details. Each member of your team need to fill the form too. Team size should be 2 to 5. If you don't have a team, you can come to event and join other team and use your experience to build something.

What's the take away?
Win exciting Google goodies.
We are calling few innovative startups with whom you can connect.

Last date to fill in this form: 10th December[masked]:00 pm
events.how_to_find_us:
KIIT TBI is near KIIT Law university campus. 
Once you enter campus, tell security you are there to attend Hackathon being organized by GDG and KIIT TBI.

events.name: Design Sprint - Create Great Products
events.description:
Event Date: 13 January, Sunday
Timing: 9:30 am to 1:30 pm
Venue: KIIT TBI, Patia, Bhubaneshwar

How to attend this event?
Step 1. Fill this form to register: https://goo.gl/forms/6AijkxSaFthqnh5y1
Step 2: Join the waitlist here: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/events/257677207/
Step 3: Go through all the FAQs of the event mentioned below.

What is the design sprint?
A design sprint is a time-constrained, five-phase process that uses design thinking with the aim of reducing the risk when bringing a new product, service or a feature to the market. In simple words, it is turning your idea into a prototype for building a new product.

What's the agenda?
Your team will be given a problem statement to solve. Your team needs to finish the task. The best team wins.

What will be the problem statement to solve?
You will be given the problem statement on the event day.

Am I eligible for the Design Sprint?
If you are one of the following, then you are fit for the event.
1) Developers and product owners
2) UX/UI Designers

Note: If you are a student and creative enough to turn your idea into a product, decide its flow, mockups, and prototype then this event is for you too.

Why be a part of this?
- Design Sprint will help you define and mount viable product with a validation plan in the markets.
- Good opportunity to turn ideas to product

Is it teamwork? How can I form a team?
Yes, it is. You can come to the event and form the team.

What's the takeaway?
Win exciting Google goodies and great learning experience.

Note: Registration closes as we reach 90 registrations.

Seats are limited. See you at the event!

events.name: Actions on Google with Luminaire/KIITFEST

Your RSVP won't be confirmed if you skip any of the step mentioned above

Event Requirements
Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger and mobile hotspot.

A little bit of JavaScript knowledge would be required for you to understand what is being presented in the Sessions. Please make sure that you're familiar with basic JavaScript concepts like Arrow Functions, Callbacks, Promises, Document Object Model(DOM) etc. These links are clickable and should give you a pretty good understanding of the above-mentioned topics.

Arrow Functions - https://medium.freecodecamp.org/when-and-why-you-should-use-es6-arrow-functions-and-when-you-shouldnt-3d851d7f0b26

Callbacks VS Promises VS Observables VS Async-Await - https://www.academind.com/learn/javascript/callbacks-vs-promises-vs-rxjs-vs-async-awaits/

DOM - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XD7fYLQeQIg

Participants learn how to use Angular to develop high-quality, interactive responsive web frontends.

The target audience for this workshop:
1) Those just getting started with web development
2) Those with programming experience on other web frameworks.

Why be a part of this workshop?
-> Work with Google Developer Expert to build web frontend using Angular.
-> Learn how to set up your environment and start building your first Angular application
-> Learn about fundamentals: Routing, Modules, App Components, UI Interaction, and Packages
-> Learn how to structure and architect your app
events.how_to_find_us: At Silicon Gate 2, ask for the way to "Remote Control Room"

events.name: IWD Bhubaneswar 2019 - Lift as you Climb
events.description:
How to attend this event?
1. Complete your profile (incomplete profile won't be confirmed for the event). Ignore, if already done.
[IMPORTANT FOR PERFECT T-SHIRT SIZE]
- https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/profile/
2. Join waitlist here: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/events/259183646
Your RSVP won't be confirmed if you skip any of the step mentioned above.

We are proud to be hosting the 2019 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

We are going to have many experienced techies and entrepreneurs, sharing their experiences and giving us tips to climb up into our paths. Getting lifts like this is worth our time!

Venue: KIIT Campus 11 Auditorium, BioTech campus
Google Map link: https://bit.ly/venue-kiit
Date: Sunday, 10th March 2019
Time: 9:30 am to 3:30 pm

Registration closes on 7th March, 3pm.

Event Agenda: Lift as You Climb!
09:30 - Registrations
10:00 - Welcome Note and Introductions
10:10 - Why be a part of communities like WTM & GDG?
10:30 - Web development and Angular
11:00 - Insights to Open Source Technologies
11:30 - IOT: The Next Big Thing
11:50 - Break
12:05 - Campus placements and Certifications Hype!
12:30 - Should you Meditate?
13:00 - Lunch and networking
14:00 - #IAmRemarkable
15:00 - Networking and fun event

Don't panic, if you see yourself on the waitlist. We'll confirm your seat by 9th March subject to terms.
If you are coming to the event from outside Bhubaneswar, mail us at [masked] . We understand you need to book your travel tickets.

Hope to see you at the event.

Note: GDG Bhubaneswar has a very strict no-show policy for all events which might affect your seat confirmation in our events. If your seat is confirmed, you need to attend the event.

We have partnered with KIIT E Summit by KIIT E-Cell for this event.

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam - Machine Learning
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

To attend, here is the 3-step registration process:
1. Signup at Meetup.com and Join the waitlist here
- https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/events/258121277/
2. Fill the registration form
- https://goo.gl/forms/rTWl9PR2PybHVXew2
3. Complete your profile (incomplete profile won't be confirmed for the event). Ignore, if already done.
- https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/profile/

After our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete in any labs you want.

Venue: Silicon Institute of Technology, Infocity, Patia, Bbsr
Workshop Hall Name: Remote Center
Date: 16th March 2019
Time: 2pm to 6pm

Your RSVP won't be confirmed if you skip any of the step mentioned above

Event Requirements
Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger and mobile hotspot.

Target audience:
1. Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?

The registration will close on 14th March, at 11 pm.

The seats are limited. We'll shortlist attendees from 13th March onwards. If confirmed, you'll see your name in the meetup's event page under attendees list and you'll be marked as "GOING" by us.

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit 2019 Extended Bhubaneswar
events.description:
TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for two days of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.
It is no question that machine learning is one of the hottest and one of the most important technology topic for developers and we think you can use this as an opportunity to build local machine learning community or engage with your local machine learning users!

events.name: Next ‘19 Extended Bhubaneswar
events.description:
What are Next ’19 Extended events?
Next Extended brings together developer communities around the world to take part in the Next ’19 experience.
These events are extensions of Next - allowing local developers to access exciting Next ’19 content and engage with peers across the community through hands-on labs and speaker events.

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 Bhubaneswar
events.description:
Experience Google IO 2019 at our own city, in Bhubaneswar.

Agenda:
1. Ten Updates from TensorFlow 2.0
: Sayak Paul, Google Developer Expert, ML and Data Science Instructor at DataCamp
2. Flutter at I/O 19 - Recap and Highlights
: Pooja Bhaumik, Google Developer Expert, Flutter
3. What's new in Android: Google I/O 2019?
: Sriyank Siddhartha, Pluralsight Author and Android Developer
4. Enable yourself in Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
: Karan Shaw, Technical Lead at Nexright
5. Building Interactive Games for Google Assistant.
: Khusboo Kumari, Integration Specialist at Nexright & Co-Founder of Trybotics
6. Angular in 2K19?
: Sumeet Roy, Full-stack Developer @ TATA Consultancy Services
7. Building Modern Screens using Modern Layouts in Android
: Samsruti Dash, Android Developer at PARI Technologies, Malaysia
8. Make Google Search Interactive
: Ved Prakash Suman, Full Stack Developer

Important: Join the waitlist only if you are in Bhubaneswar on the event date and planning to join it without a miss.

upcoming.name: Angular Hands-on Workshop: Intermediate Level
upcoming.description:
Hands-on workshop on Angular.

Event Details:
Date: 13th July 2019
Time: 2:30 pm to 5:30 pm
Venue: Silicon Institute of Technology, Patia, Bhubaneshwar

To attend, here is the 3-step registration process :
1. Signup at Meetup.com and Join the waitlist here
-https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/events/262917425/
2. Fill the registration form
- https://forms.gle/egEGAfAdAegA7xRn9
3. Complete your profile (incomplete profile won't be confirmed for the event). Ignore, if already done.
- https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/profile/

Your RSVP won't be confirmed if you skip any of the step mentioned above

Event Requirements
- Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.
- For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.
- Don’t forget your laptop charger.
- There will be no wifi, so bring your mobile hotspot.
- Charging points will be limited, so get an extension cord.

Since it is intermediate, you will need to have knowledge on the basics of Angular like what is templating, how to declare components, how angular DI works.
Reference slides can be found here: https://bit.ly/2XCqRZG

Expected Topics to learn at the workshop:
RxJS
Simple operation over RxJS streams
Event-driven components
Custom directives
And interop with reactjs/jquery/vuejs etc
Testing in Angular

The target audience for this workshop:
1) Those who are familiar with Angular
2) Those with programming experience on other web frameworks.

The registration will close on 11th July, at 3:00 pm.

The seats are limited. We will be shortlisting participants from 9th itself. If confirmed, you'll see your name in the meetup's event page under attendees list and you'll be marked as "GOING" by us.
upcoming.how_to_find_us: At Silicon Gate 2, ask for the way to "Remote Control Room"

upcoming.name: Kotlin/Everywhere 2019 GDG Bhubaneswar: Build Great Apps
upcoming.description:
Kotlin/Everywhere is a global series of community-led events where developers can learn the essentials and best practices of Kotlin in Android, Google Cloud Platform, and multiplatform development.

Want to get started with Kotlin, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Kotlin/Everywhere event.
First, you will understand Kotlin as JVM language and leverage its powerful features. Thereafter, get your hands dirty by building Android apps using Kotlin.

We are looking to engage the Android developer community more on using Kotlin as their primary stack for developing Android Apps. The event is set to have seasoned developers with vast experience in building Android Applications in the Kotlin way. Lots of learning resource, Codelabs, and Freebies to share. You can't afford to miss out on this one.

To attend this event, you need to install tools such as Android Studio and Emulator before coming to the event.

**** Registration starts 15 days prior to the event *****
upcoming.how_to_find_us: Hall Name: Remote Center, CS Building 2nd Floor

upcoming.name: DevFest 2019
upcoming.description:
NOTE: At present when you RSVP, you'll be moved to the waitlist. Once the registration process is over we'll confirm your seat based on some criteria.

What is DevFest?
Watch the video here: https://bit.ly/devfest-gdg

DevFests are community-led, developer events hosted by GDG chapters around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies. Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community and region that hosts it.

Event Agenda and Details

To participate, here is the simple registration process :
--> RSVP and join the waitlist here. Don't forget to answer the simple question after you join the waitlist.
--> Complete your profile (incomplete profile won't be confirmed for the event). Ignore, if already done.
- https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Bhubaneswar/profile/

The registration will close on 15th September, 10 pm.

Seats are limited. See you in DevFest.

Featured sessions:

Many other sessions on #AndroidDev, #TensorFlow, #Angular #Kotlin #Dart #Flutter #MachineLearning, #GoogleCloud. Visit interesting sandboxes, chill, and network at Community Lounge, participate in networking and fun events.

Important: GDG Bhubaneswar has a very strict no-show policy for all events which might affect your seat confirmation in our future events. If your seat is confirmed, you have to attend the event.
